intro: Bihai episcopalis, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 12 inches in diameter. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with rough, hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color and bloom throughout the year, making it a popular ornamental plant. Bihai episcopalis thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and requires well-drained soil and full sun exposure.
